intro: Scelochilus rubriflorus, commonly known as the red-flowered scelochilus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its striking red petals and a unique floral structure that distinguishes it from other orchid species. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture, though it remains relatively rare in the wild.
